title: Are there any recommended K-pop dance to dance to for K-pop company auditions? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, based on my experience you have to WOW the judges so you can get accepted. For Girl Groups ONLY ( sorry Boy groups are hard to impersonate for me) Rumor by Produce 48  (G)-IDLE HANN or LATATA   EXID I LOVE YOU  Egotistic by Mamamoo  SIREN SUNMI  LA VIE EN ROSE IZONE  There's more from Chungha,RED VELVET, and other songs from the artist I chose from above. The reason I didn't choose any popular groups like Blackpink and TWICE is because of their popularity. I'm sure if you did choose from their dances surely someone will have the same chosen dance as you. For my experience in my club if someone has the same song chosen as the other they will choose who's version or who's dancing is better. Although these people or groups I chose are also popular like IZONE,Mamamoo and GIDLE these groups will give you an advantage since our KPOP president said there's a higher chance you'll get accepted if you dance good OR you dance to unpopular groups. If you dance to unpopular groups they will say or think you know a lot about KPOP. Another reason you shouldn't dance to popular songs is that some judges would think you only know about popular groups and have no knowledge of older and underrated KPOP groups. Yes, some aren't fair but it's just how it works. TIPS FOR PERFORMING If you dance to these KPOP groups you need to act like them, like your part of their group. If you dance to Mamamoo or EXID be fierce If you dance to IOI, TWICE, the velvet side or RED VELVET act cute and smile If you dance to Sistar act cute but sexy and smile. Notice in their MV that they act sexy but they look cute while doing it. If you want like BP and (G)-IDLE then you need to have swag while you dance. Mouth the lyrics. You need to act like your the one singing the song. Expression. Like I said imitate the vibe your chosen dance is.Observe everything from the group dancing and imitate it while your performing. Enjoy.

(I’m going to just say that actually, they don’t need you to dance Kpop just because they are a Korean entertainment company. If english songs work better for you, they don’t really care. After all, Kpop is not a genre of dance, only an expression of it. So you should do what best expresses yourself. But anyway to answer the question…) From a dancing perspective, I recommend choosing songs with strong choreography. Reason being that strong choreography really tests your body’s flexibility, adaptability and the coordination/isolation of your various muscle groups performing these dances. However, also bear in mind that not every song is particularly difficult. Examples that come to mind are Orange Caramel’s songs; they aren’t particularly difficult, and you wouldn’t really show any ability that causes them to give you a second look. For this reason, many new idol groups (particularly boy groups) have members with experience in ‘flashy’ dances, like hiphop and B-Boying. Regarding freestyle dances, I’d say prepare a bit, but don’t expect too much about it. Shows like MixNine, PD101, etc tend to show people asking for (and receiving) random songs to ‘test’ their dancing skills. The reality is that it doesn’t really show much, and is just more footage for the PDs to show people that they like so. If you’re good, you’re good, and usually the people observing will know. Remember that they are creating a Kpop group that has dances choreographed for them. Creation isn’t as important as the ability to pick up quickly in the Kpop world.

Its really what you want! I’m no expert on this,but i will try to give what I think will be good. Difficult/Hard dances: Chungha-Stay tonight(You should have confidence in this one.I think this is hard because their are a lot of little moves to remember.) Verivery-Lay back(I think it would be amazing if you could do this one.) Oneus-A song written easily(This is a song that looks like your flying,but your not.Idk how to explain >o<) Seventeen-Highlight Loona-Butterfly(would lovvee to see this!!) Red Velvet-Rookie Itzy-Not shy Middle dances: Twice-Fancy( This song is a mature type of song.It’s not to hard or to easy.Try and and focus on the facial expressions and how the mood is.) Jennie-Solo( I little this is a good song for audition.You got to have that confidence) BTS-Boy with luv(I don’t know if this is an easy song,but you move around a lot. In this song you have to really bright and happy inside.) Kard-Bomb Bomb(It looks hard,but i think it has some easy parts to it.I think it’s doable. Blackpink-How you like that(This is a powerful song.When dancing to this your moves have to strong and just fierce.) Easy/Practice dances: Oh my girl-Nonstop Gfriend-Fever( I learned this dance myself.I think it’s pretty easy.) Red Velvet-Umpah( This one was okayly easy to do.) Hwasa-Twit(Easy movements) G-idle-Oh my god(I think this song will improve your facial expressions) I really don’t know if these are good for an audition,but I really tried. Anyways it’s up to you on what song you want to dance to. To me these are all good songs with great choreography. I think it’s about how you bring it. How much emotion and power you bring with the dance. Well good luck for your audition!! FIGHTINGGGGGG.

There are many different styles of dance, and you should choose a song which represents your style perfectly. If you’re not good with songs that are upbeat and fast, don’t do dances that are upbeat and fast. In auditions, you need to choose songs which suit YOU the best, not which songs or dances that are the most popular. The focus should be YOU and YOUR skills. I’ve also read from other places that companies don’t really like when applicants dance to a song that their group has released. For example, don’t dance Ddu-ddu-ddu to YG Entertainment since they are the ones who made that song and choreographed it. Chances are, they are the experts of that song and dance. Don’t make them compare you with their own experienced and professional dancers. If anything, do a song that is not done a lot. This will be a fresh sound in the ears of the people who are watching hours and hours of auditions.

Okay, people that keep up with my posts and answers would know that I have 3 docs on my preparations for any K-Pop company audition, just in case I don’t get past my first audition this week. I really like the choreography of ‘Killing Me’ by iKon, there’s a lot of small details that takes a while for beginners to notice, but I noticed all of them right away. Yes, this is my attempt to brag, it was cringy, don’t mind me, omg, that rhymed- ‘Ice Cream’ by BLACKPINK ft. Selene Gomez has a charismatic chreography and I’ll only be giving one more suggestion, no one’s taking all my preparations :p And ‘Wannabe’ by ITZY. Peace!
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Bunny Playz Roblox

response.answer_text: If it's your first-ever audition try something your use to. (I think that older kpop dances are easier.)And make sure you practice in HIGH heels and 5-pound weights on your ankle and wrist. This helps your motions look sharp and helps you feel light on your feet. And the heels are so you’re already used to heels when showing them. (: If you work hard enough you may make it! Have fun and don't go on extreme diets!! Fighting!!<3

Pick a really good choreography that requires stamina, but not so much that you can’t sing or rap while dancing to it. In order to see where you’re at with the choreography, try filming yourself while practicing it so you can see more easily where you need to improve and work on it. Practice everyday because if you practice a lot, you’ll get better. It doesn’t really matter which language the song’s (or songs) in as long as you look good and it shows your talent as a dancer. Good luck. Life as a trainee is hard from what I’ve heard.

Don’t do a Kpop dance! You’re more likely to fail if you do. I would say to look at many different dance videos from youtube channels! You can look at 1 Million Dance Studio’s dance videos. But sometimes their choreography can be hard 😅 I tried it before and let me tell you, it did not look good. But yeah just look for a couple dance videos on youtube and choose which one you think you can do! Best of luck with your audition! Hope this answered your question 😊! ~Aesthetically Beauty 🌹
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Bunny Playz Roblox

response.answer_text: Well if you audition in person, you will not have the advantage of preparing a dance before hand usually. They will just play some music and you will free style. However if you do get the chance to perform a prepared dance, then yes, hip-hop is a very popular style, but you could also do something completely different (such as ballet, maybe?). Whatever you do you need to set yourself apart from everyone else so doing the most popular style may actually be a negative thing.

Sorry for late reply and also sorry for my bad english There isnt a specific dance because at the end of the day no comapy want to see anything choreographed they want to see you groove to a song and just let your body flow with music if that makes sense. If your perform something choreographed it brings ur chances down TRUST ME I KNOW. Even if your terrible at dancing its fine As long as They can see that You arent As stiff as a rock and have Rythem

No, there is no specific dance you have to do. I would do something that you’re comfortable doing and that’ll impress them. You also have to make up your own dance because they need to see if you are worthy or not. I would defiantly look off a lot of kpop dances to help you decide what style you’re going for.

I really don’t know what to advise. I have never seen an audition. I don’t know what they think. Or what they want to see. I imagine many people do a KPop cover. You could try something different. Try a hip hop cover. Who is your favorite dancer? As long as you don’t making money it’s not illegal.

response.answer_text: -How You Like That by BLACKPINK. -Left & Right by SEVENTEEN. -Hann by G-Idle. -Boy by TREASURE. -Run by BTS. -Forever Young by BLACKPINK. -Kill This Love by BLACKPINK. -Umpah Umpah by RedVelvet. -Bboom Bboom by Momoland. Yeah and I think that’s it, choose the song that you are most comfortable with! ~Linki

I will recommend BTS for you:) but if I’m not wrong, in company auditions they prefer freestyle dance, not cover dance. Like SM Global Audition, they will play a music for you and then you will show them a freestyle dance

Certainly Hip hop is pretty big. You can clearly see it in every korean music video you come across too. The style of hip hop is the biggest influencer on k-industry. That’s what makes them big too. So I suggests you do a hip hop choreography, but if you want to do something else that’s ok;)

Choose songs that you’re comfortable to dance to and songs that fits your style. There’s no exact songs that are good to dance to during your audition. It really depends on your style. Hope I helped you, good luck if you do audition! :)
